decks.notes: This deck focuses on assembling a fast and aggressive board presence with a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. It aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain control of the battlefield through a mix of creatures with useful abilities and removal spells. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion ensures additional flexibility and provides a powerful late-game threat. The deck also incorporates a strong mana base to support its multicolored spells and maximize consistency. Overall, it is a well-rounded aggro deck that can adapt to different situations and put the opponent on the back foot quickly.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to use powerful creatures and spells to out-value and outlast the opponent. By using cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Necrodominance, the deck aims to grind down the opponent's resources while maintaining card advantage through Thoughtseize and Grief. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Fell the Profane to control the board, as well as ways to generate extra mana with Phyrexian Tower and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent quickly by utilizing cheap and efficient burn spells such as Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Boros Charm. The deck also includes creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide to further pressure the opponent. Searing Blaze and Roiling Vortex help control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to maintain a fast pace and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The deck focuses on quickly burning down the opponent's life total to secure a quick victory.

This Mono Black Aggro deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategies with cards like Thoughtseize and Grief, while also using aggressive creatures like Dauthi Voidwalker and Boggart Trawler to quickly close out the game. The deck also includes some recursion with cards like Necrodominance and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, allowing you to keep up the pressure even after your creatures have been dealt with. Additionally, the deck has some removal options such as Fatal Push and Fell the Profane to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of disruption and aggression.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells and utilizing removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge. It also aims to generate card advantage through Snapcaster Mage and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. Murktide Regent and Flame of Anor provide threats to close out the game while Invert Polarity and Subtlety offer unique ways to disrupt opponent's plans. The deck also includes a variety of fetch lands to fix mana and dig through the deck with Preordain. Overall, the deck is designed to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly and efficiently ramp up mana using cards like Attune with Aether and Aether Hub in order to cheat out powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre through cards like Aetherworks Marvel and Through the Breach. Delighted Halfling can help with card draw and finding key combo pieces. Jegantha, the Wellspring acts as the companion card for additional consistency. The deck focuses on high-impact, game-winning plays that can overwhelm the opponent in just a few turns.
